property.name: description
property.content: Matches any E element (i.e., an element of type E)

property.name: description
property.content: Matches any F element that is a descendant of an E element

property.name: description
property.content: Matches any F element that is a child of an E element

property.name: description
property.content: Matches any F element immediately preceded by a sibling element E

property.name: description
property.content: Matches any element with ID equal to "myid".

property.name: description
property.content: In HTML, matches any element whose class attribute is a list of space-separated values, one of which is exactly equal to "warning"

property.name: description
property.content: Matches any E element with the "foo" attribute set (whatever the value)

property.name: description
property.content: Matches any E element whose "foo" attribute value is exactly equal to "warning"

property.name: description
property.content: Matches any E element whose "foo" attribute value is a list of space-separated values, one of which is exactly equal to "warning"

property.name: description
property.content: Matches any E element whose "lang" attribute has a hyphen-separated list of values beginning (from the left) with "en"

property.name: description
property.content: matches the name of any element type

property.name: description
property.content: Matches element E if it is in (human) language c (the document language specifies how language is determined)

property.name: description
property.content: Matches element E when E is the first child of its parent

property.name: description
property.content: Matches element E if E is the source anchor of a hyperlink of which the target is not yet visited

property.name: description
property.content: Matches element E if E is the source anchor of a hyperlink of which the target is already visited

property.name: description
property.content: Matches E when E is activated by the user

property.name: description
property.content: Matches E while the user designates an element (with some pointing device), but does not activate it

property.name: description
property.content: Matches E while while it has the focus

property.name: description
property.content: The @import rule allows to import style rules from other style sheets. Any @import rules must precede all other rules (except @charset)

property.name: Syntax
property.content: The @import keyword must be followed by the URI of the style sheet to include. A string is also allowed; it will be interpreted as if it had url(...) around it. Media-dependent import can be specified with comma-separated media types after the URI.

property.name: description
property.content: An @page rule consists of the keyword "@page", followed by an optional page selector, followed by a block of declarations. The declarations in an @page rule are said to be in the page context and are useful to write CSS rules for paged media (e.g. for printing on paper).

property.name: description
property.content: An @media rule specifies the target media types (separated by commas) of a set of statements (delimited by curly braces)

property.name: values
property.content: all, braille, embossed, handheld, print, projection, screen, speech, tty, tv

property.name: description
property.content: The @charset rule defines the encoding used in a linked style sheet. An @charset rule must be placed at the very beginning of the style sheet, preceded by no characters, and the name of the encoding should follow in quotes.
